content: a modern take on the baby blanket with alternating single_crochet and simple patterned stripes it works up quickly and is easy enough for even new crocheters it s easy to adjust to a different size too depending on the yardage of your yarn this would be beautiful done in just two colors too plus it s completely reversible although gauge is not critical for this project it may change yardage needed the patterned stripes in this blanket used the entire skein of yarn and the single_crochet stripes took just shy of the whole skein if your skeins have different yardage or if you re gauge is different you many want to adjust the size of the stripes or the width of the blanket the pattern stitch is a two stitch repeat so you can change the stitch count at the beginning by a multiple of two stitches and the pattern will still come out right finished size 31-3/4 x 42 used 7 skeins of berroco modern cotton 209 yds/skein #1603 piper #1624 salty brine #1628 iggy #1614 vireo #1611 rocky point #1657 lippet #1663 hope or any worsted weight yarn
